Content:: Stage races Mike Teunissen (born 25 August 1992) is a Dutch racing cyclist,[5] who currently rides for UCI WorldTeam Team Jumbo–Visma.[6] He rode at the 2013 UCI Road World Championships, and was the winner of the World Under-23 Cyclo-cross Championships in 2013. He was named in the start list for the 2015 Vuelta a Espa√±a.[7] In June 2017, he was named in the startlist for the 2017 Tour de France.[8] In July 2019, Teunissen won the opening stage of the 2019 Tour de France, winning the Yellow Jersey in the process.[9]
